title: Which Emojis are Used to Represent Weed?

steps.title: Herb (🌿)
steps.content: Herb (🌿) In this context, this emoji represents the cannabis herb, not the culinary variety found in a spice cabinet.

steps.title: Leaf fluttering in the wind (🍃)
steps.content: Leaf fluttering in the wind (🍃) The direction of the leaf's fluttering motion is open to interpretation, but cannabis enthusiasts often use it as “soaring high.”

steps.title: Wind (💨)
steps.content: Wind (💨) The wind or "dash" emoji has evolved to signify not just speed, but also the act of smoking marijuana. Similarly, the weed emoji is frequently used to propose or arrange a joint smoking session.

steps.title: Broccoli (🥦)
steps.content: Broccoli (🥦) Many have used the broccoli emoji for its resemblance to a cannabis flower. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Maple leaf (🍁)
steps.content: Maple leaf (🍁) The maple leaf, long associated with cozy autumn vibes, was also one of the original symbols used to represent cannabis. This connection likely stemmed from the leaf's visual similarity to a marijuana leaf. However, as new cannabis-themed emojis emerged, and many Canadians objected to the maple leaf's drug-related connotation, the symbol's popularity has waned in recent years. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Four-leaf clover (🍀)
steps.content: Four-leaf clover (🍀) The cannabis leaf, a green icon, often appeals to those who refer to marijuana as "clover.” [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pineapple (🍍)
steps.content: Pineapple (🍍) This is a nod to the marijuana plant's distinctive appearance—mostly the dried flowering tops of the plant. Much like the ubiquitous pineapple emoji, the stoner classic film Pineapple Express has also contributed to the pineapple's association with cannabis culture. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Christmas tree (🎄)
steps.content: Christmas tree (🎄) The evergreen tree emoji was first used to represent cannabis due to its connection with the slang term "tree," often used by rappers. However, as cannabis culture evolved, enthusiasts needed a way to differentiate between average weed and the higher quality strains. So the Christmas tree emoji emerged as a symbol for the "good stuff." [5] X Research source

steps.title: Deciduous tree (🌳)
steps.content: Deciduous tree (🌳) Much like the broccoli emoji, many find that the deciduous tree resembles dried buds of weed.

steps.title: Potted Plant (🪴)
steps.content: Potted Plant (🪴) Weed, also sometimes called “pot,” is a plant, so it’s only natural that some associate the plant in a pot emoji with, well, pot.

steps.title: The alembic (⚗️)
steps.content: The alembic (⚗️) The emoji keyboard’s addition of the alembic, an obscure chemical distillation device, provided the cannabis community with a recognizable bong symbol, which was well-received. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Cigarette (🚬)
steps.content: Cigarette (🚬) The cigarette emoji, though technically representing a tobacco product, can serve as a symbol for a joint.

steps.title: Face Exhaling (😮‍💨)
steps.content: Face Exhaling (😮‍💨) This emoji, while intended to look like someone letting out a big puff of air, also resembles a face blowing smoke out of its mouth. Many people use this emoji to convey that they are currently smoking, about to smoke, or they’re calling the person they’re talking to a “stoner.” [7] X Research source

steps.title: Face in Clouds (😶‍🌫️)
steps.content: Face in Clouds (😶‍🌫️) The clouded face emoji captures the hazy, disoriented feeling that comes after getting stoned.

steps.title: Relaxed face with wind (😌💨)
steps.content: Relaxed face with wind (😌💨) When the relaxed, relieved face is combined with the wind emoji, this can often mean someone is high to the point where they feel at ease and content.

steps.title: Concerned face with fluttering leaves (😳🍃)
steps.content: Concerned face with fluttering leaves (😳🍃) When someone is stoned, they can feel a bit spacey and out of it, which is what this combination is trying to represent.

steps.title: Big eyes with fried eggs (😶🍳)
steps.content: Big eyes with fried eggs (😶🍳) In words, this person is trying to convey that they are “fried,” or extremely stoned.

steps.title: Concerned face with flame (😳🔥)
steps.content: Concerned face with flame (😳🔥) Positioning the concerned emoji alongside the fire emoji can suggest someone is "lit,” or high. Given the common slang of referring to high-quality marijuana as "fire," the fire emoji can also imply the potency or excellence of the product.
